intro: Diasperus lacteus, commonly known as the milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, with a distinctive tubular shape. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Diasperus lacteus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
